revised_title: Observations and Experiments by Monsieur Hevelius
tldr: This article contains various observations and experiments conducted by Monsieur Hevelius, including his calculation of the Solar Eclipse's quantity and duration, the figure of a star in the Cygnus constellation, and a new star discovered in it. Additionally, it discusses a method for measuring planetary diameters and the parallax of the Moon, as well as other natural phenomena such as the Bononian Stone, Swedish Stone, and Salamanders living in fire.
